Detailed Description

This abstract class implements the stObject interface. This interface is required by the objects that will be indexed by the metric trees implemented by this library. Since these metric trees are implemented as class templates, any class that implements all methods defined in this interface may be indexed by a metric tree.

This class may be used as the base class for classes that implements the objects which will be indexed by a metric tree but this use is not recommended.

Version
1.0

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

stObject::stObject ( )
inline

Builds a new uninitialized instance of this class. The resulting instance must be ready to be initializated by a Unserialize() call.

Note
This constructor is required to fulfil the stObject interface.

Member Function Documentation

virtual stObject* stObject::Clone ( )
pure virtual

This method must create a clone (copy) of this class. The new instance must have the same behaviour of the original instance but can not keep any links to its creator (they are independent). In other words, the clone will not reflect any changes done in the original class.

Returns
The clone (copy) of this object.
Note
This method is required to fulfil the stObject interface.

Implemented in stBasicArrayObject< DataType, OIDType >.

virtual const stByte* stObject::Serialize ( )
pure virtual

This method must create a serialized version of this instance. The serialized version is an array of bytes that will hold all information required to rebuild this object. For example, if the object is a string, the serialized form may be the string itself without the terminator character (since it is a sequence of bytes).

This array will be used by the SlimTree to store the object into a disk page and to recover it (by calling Unserialize()) and its size given by GetSerializedSize().

The effect of the of A->Unserialize(B->Serialize(), B->GetSerializedSize()) must be the same of A=B->Clone().

Implementation note: The SlimTree will not claim the ownership of the returned array. The object must dispose it when it is not required. In case of the serialized version be a pointer to an internal array, no copy operation will be necessary.

Returns
The serialized version of this object.
See also
GetSerializedSize()
Unserialized()
Note
This method is required to fulfil the stObject interface.

Implemented in stBasicArrayObject< DataType, OIDType >.

virtual void stObject::Unserialize ( const stByte *  data,
stSize  datasize 
)
pure virtual

This method must rebuild the object from its serialized version. The serialized version is an array of bytes that holds all information required to rebuild an object. For example, if the object is a string, the serialized form may be the string itself without the terminator character (since it is a sequence of bytes).

This method will be used by the SlimTree to rebuild the object to compare it with another object (the sample object in a query or another rebuilt object).

The effect of the of A->Unserialize(B->Serialize(), B->GetSerializedSize()) must be the same of A=B->Clone().

Implementation note: The SlimTree is the owner of the data array. This means that this array may vanish at any time after the call of Unserialize(). There is also another restriction. The Unserialize() method must never modify the contents of the data array.

Parameters
dataThe serialized object.
datasizeThe size (in bytes) of the data array.
See also
Serialized()
Note
This method is required to fulfil the stObject interface.

Implemented in stBasicArrayObject< DataType, OIDType >.
